document_data.mainbody: '''Snow spider''' was a species of hunting arachnid-looking animals adapted to cold climate of the arctic. Often sharing habitat with [[ice spider]]s, they were good swimmers and were led by a queen.
document_data.Description:
Upon a casual glance, snow spiders appeared to be hairy, muscled, arachnids with eight legs. In reality, they were warm-blooded mammals.{{Cite dungeon/46/The Iron Orb of the Duergar|57}} Snow spiders were covered in hard and thick white hairs on the head and back, while their legs were striped with pale grays and browns.

They had eight eyes of pale blue color and a pair of menacing chelicerae protruding from under their horrific heads. Snow spiders varied in size, depending on their age. The heads were connected to flexible necks, similar to those of [[owl]]s, further distinguishing snow spiders from true arachnids. Their feet had three clawed and webbed toes facing forward and one back. The webbed feet aided them in both swimming and crossing snowdrifts.
document_data.Abilities:
Unlike ice spiders, snow spiders were not web-spinners. Thanks to their ''[[tremorsense]]'', snow spiders could feel any creature within {{SI|60'|'"|long=yes}} from them that touched the ground, and they had keen eyesight. However, their senses of smell and hearing were average. They were capable swimmers and climbers, and their white tufts of fur made them quite proficient at camouflaging.

Snow spiders were immune to such mind-affecting spells and abilities as ''[[compulsion]]'', ''[[charm]]'', ''[[hypnotic pattern]]'', and ''[[phantasm]]s''. Even though their fur was flammable and vulnerable to natural fire, it was resistant to magical flames, and they were unaffected by non-magical cold.
document_data.Behavior:
Snow spiders were known for their aggression. They hunted, wandering through subarctic bogs, rivers, and everfrost. These arachnids relied on their paralyzing venom.

They hunted in packs between five and fifteen individuals. Snow spiders' preferred hunting time was just before dawn and after sunset. A pack of snow spiders worked together, scouting, ambushing, and attacking in synch with each other.

Snow spiders communicated via series of clicks and chirrs, as well as a rudimentary form of sign language while hunting. Because of their anatomy, they could not learn another language but could be trained to understand it.
document_data.Combat: Like many of their kin, snow spiders attacked, pouncing from ambush, lading a quick venom injection, and dragging the paralyzed prey into a snowbank, a cave, or a tunnel. If the attacking spider missed or failed to paralyze its target, it darted back into safety before the prey could retaliate. If the victim was not paralyzed, snow spiders could choose to bite prey instead, damaging them with their corrosive acidic saliva or impaling them with the clawed appendages.

Ecology.Habitats:
Snow spiders, along with ice spiders, were known to inhabit the banks of the [[Iceflow]] river in [[northwest Faerûn]].

Snow spiders inhabited cold regions where snow rarely left the ground. They burrowed deep into rocky hills, building homes in well-hidden areas. In warmer months, snow spiders fell into semi-hibernation, coming out of their dens only several times per season late at night. In warmer temperatures, above 50F, snow spiders were slow and sluggish, while in winter, they hunted in packs and moved with darting speed.

Their burrows did not contain any treasure, as snow spiders did not care for wealth. However, magical items and [[gold]] were dragged into their lairs occasionally, along with the unfortunate prey.
Ecology.Usages: Snow spiders' saliva could be collected and used as [[acid]].

document_data.History: In the {{YearlinkName|1312}}, wooly spiders were kept as cattle by the [[monstrous humanoid]] force of the [[Legion of the Chimera]] that menaced the [[Ten-Towns]] of [[Icewind Dale]]. [[Goblin]]s of the Legion were particularly partial to the wooly spider meat. The creatures were held in a gated off portion of a cave and fed with unlucky individuals and captured wild beasts of the north.
